page.title: 01 ::::The Chilton Area::::
page.content: :::::::::::::::::::::::::::: This area, on the Oxfordshire/ Berkshire border, is predominantly undulating farming land, both arable and pastural, around the main centre of population,the village of Chilton. The village itself is in the centre of a plain just beneath the upper chalk scarps of the Berkshire Downs. {Ancient tracks, the Portway and the Icknield Way, pass to the north, and the Ridgeway crosses the Downs above the village to then south.} The main communication route this century has been the north-south A34 trunk road. As the village lies off the main route, its narrow roads have never been subjected to the vast increase in traffic, and it has remained a Downland village of character. ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
